title: download issues
content:
hi i`m in a complete mess.

i donated as requested then i have lost everything no d/load links , no redirects , ZIP. why is it so difficult to navigate to a d/load ?

i`m trying to restore my TB after my current version failed to d/load e-mails from server this all seemed to happen after latest up-dates its been faultless before this please someone restore my sanity some one on one help would be appreciated

thanks
creator: mokuy1

title: 128.9.1esr
content: Apparently Thunderbird updated itself to 128.9.1esr this afternoon when I restarted my computer. It is now completely useless, I can neither send nor receive email. It was fine this morning, when I presume I still had 128.9.0. My ISP is worse than useless, if you aren't using their lame webmail interface, you don't have a solvable problem. I downgraded back to 128.9.0 by following this post: https://www.reddit.com/r/Thunderbird/comments/16jwt7a/%E2%84%B9_how_to_downgrade_from_thunderbird_115_to_102/ It retrieved email exactly once. I closed and reopened Thunderbird and it hasn't worked since. I've repeatedly deleted the compatibility.ini file. I tried updating to the current version and downgrading again and it isn't working. What do I try next?
creator: cable198

title: I need to change my default email address in TB
content: Hi, my company email domain was closed by Google as it was wound up which stopped my email address from working, my old email address was john@jfmcivil.com.au I have a new email address, but the old one is still on my emails, if anyone replies to that address, I won't get the email which is happening. Please advise how I can change the default email address in TB. My new address is: john@jfmcontracting.com.au M. 0408475144 (Australia) Kind regards John McFaul
creator: john1171

title: Login fails for Thunderbird
content: I've been using Thunderbird for years to access my gmail account through my ieee alias. Sometime after 4/2/2025 my login fails with the message "Login to server imap.googlemail.com....failed". I've tried changing the imap server to "imap.gmail.com" but get similar results. For some reason, it appears that something changed on 4/3 that prevents a successful login to the gmail server from Tbird. I have both Tbird and gmail configured for OAuth2.
creator: blahey1
